rComments: Paul is a special soul, a star that shines bright. Being in his class to witness his contagious glimmering presence, inspires and drives students to learn more.  He genuinely gets to know a student, not out of politeness, but out of sheer curiosity and care.  Paul loves people, and people love Paul.  An outstanding actor, mentor, and human being3

I've taken two upper div reading intensive classes with Paul, and they were both excellent. While not for the faint of heart, his classes are deep, intellectually stimulating, and in my case, life-changing. (I added a major because of him and am now going to Graduate School for Theatre.) I cannot recommend him enough. Work hard. Read the plays.

Awesome class and professor. He was clear and concise yet creative. Midterm was amazing, readthrough for a character in a play and were allowed complete creativity! Not to mention his accent makes his shakespearean readings even more amazing!

Paul is a wonderful performer, and his lectures are certainly performances. But he has a very bad habit of underestimating the ability and intelligence of his students, and his class suffers for this. Suffers a lot. He has things to say, but they don't knock you over with their searing insight. A decent class that he could and should have made grea
Paul has a great English accent and the requisite passion to go with it.  He expects a lot and brings a perspective otherwise lacking.  I recommend him.
